EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: COLLEGE OF PATENT AGENTS AND TRADEMARK AGENTS ACT

Identification.LongTitle: By-laws of the College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents (College)

Provision.Text: The College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents makes the annexed By-laws of the College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents (College), pursuant to

Provision.Label: a)
Provision.Text: subsection 76(2) of the College of Patent and Trademark Agents Acta; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: section 18 of the College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents Regulations.

SignatureTitle.Language: Collège des agents de brevets et des agents de marques de commerce
College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these By-laws.

Definition.Text: Act means the College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents Act. (Loi)

class 1 with respect to a licence, describes either a patent agent licence issued under subsection 26(1) of the Act or a trademark agent licence issued under subsection 29(1) of the Act that is not covered by class 2. (catégorie 1)

class 2 with respect to a licence, describes either a patent agent licence issued under subsection 26(1) of the Act or a trademark agent licence issued under subsection 29(1) of the Act that is subject to the restrictions under section 27. (catégorie 2)

class 3 with respect to a licence, describes either a patent agent in training licence issued under subsection 26(2) of the Act or a trademark agent in training licence issued under subsection 29(2) of the Act. (catégorie 3)
Committee means the Committee of the College referred to in section 3 of the College of Patent Agent and Trademark Agents Regulations. (comité)
supervisor means a Class 1 licensee who is authorized under section 18 to be a supervisor of a Class 3 licensee. (superviseur)

Section.Text: The Committee must approve standards for the evaluation of the competencies that are to be assessed by the qualifying examinations and the passing marks for those examinations to ensure that all licensees have the necessary skills and competencies to represent persons under section 27 or 30 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: If the Registrar must determine whether an applicant is of good character, the Registrar must do so by assessing the applicant’s integrity and competence in accordance with the highest standards of the profession in order to preserve the trust, respect and confidence of members of the profession and the public.

If the Registrar must determine whether a person is fit to practise the Registrar must do so by assessing the person’s ability to be a licensee with sufficient knowledge, skill and judgment that is not substantially impaired by a physical, mental or emotional condition, disorder or addiction.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Registrar may waive or modify requirements
Subsection.Text: If it is in the public interest to do so, the Registrar may waive or modify one or more of the training and licence issuance requirements.

Section.Text: The Registrar must reasonably accommodate a Class 3 licensee if the Class 3 licensee provides medical or other information, satisfactory to the Registrar, that demonstrates the need for an accommodation to provide a fair opportunity for the Class 3 licensee to successfully complete the College’s training and meet the requirements for obtaining a Class 1 licence.
A decision of the Registrar under these By-laws must be reviewed by the Committee on the request of the affected applicant or licensee.
After reviewing the Registrar’s decision, the Committee may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: request that the Registrar obtain additional information;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: approve the application under review, with or without conditions, and specify the effective date of the decision; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: conduct a hearing and make a decision with reasons.

Section.Text: A decision of the Committee under section 5 cannot be reviewed by the Board.
If a decision of the Registrar is modified by the Committee, the Registrar must notify the applicant and, if applicable, the supervisor of the decision and give effect to the decision.
An applicant for a Class 3 patent agent licence must provide an application to the Registrar that provides proof of the applicant’s Canadian residency and must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be of good character and provide, in support, three letters of reference, a criminal background check, records of any disciplinary sanction by an academic institution or professional or non-professional body, records of any bankruptcy or insolvency, and any other information necessary for the Registrar to assess good character;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be fit to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be proficient in English or French;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: pay to the College the fee set out in item 1 of the schedule;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: provide a specimen signature, a current photograph and any other information required to confirm identity;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: have a training agreement executed by the applicant and the supervisor or a representative of the Patent Office.

Section.Text: If the Registrar issues a Class 3 patent agent licence under subsection 26(2) of the Act, the Registrar must set the effective date of the licence.
A class 3 patent agent licensee is subject to the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee must comply with the terms of the training agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee must not represent any person in the presentation or prosecution of an application for the registration of a patent or in other business before the Patent Office without the supervision of a class 1 patent agent licensee whose licence is not suspended.

Section.Text: An applicant for a Class 3 trademark agent licence must provide an application to the Registrar that provides proof of the applicant’s Canadian residency and must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be of good character and provide, in support, three letters of reference, a criminal background check, records of any disciplinary sanctions by an academic institution or professional or non-professional bodies, records of any bankruptcy or insolvency, and any other information necessary for the Registrar to assess good character;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be fit to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be proficient in English or French.

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: pay to the College the fee set out in item 1 of the schedule;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: provide a specimen signature, a current photograph and any other information required to confirm identity;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: have a training agreement executed by the applicant and the supervisor or a representative of the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks.

Section.Text: If the Registrar issues a Class 3 trademark agent licence under subsection 29(2) of the Act, the Registrar must set the effective date of the licence.
A class 3 trademark agent licence is subject to the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee must comply with the terms of the training agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee must not represent any person in the presentation or prosecution of an application for the registration of a trademark or in other business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks without the supervision of a class 1 trademark agent licensee whose licence is not suspended.

Section.Text: Prior to writing the qualifying examinations, a trainee must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: work under a training agreement for a period of 24 months; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: complete the agent training course.

Subsection.Text: A class 1 licensee may apply to the Registrar to be authorized to act as a supervisor.

A representative of the Patent Office or the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks may apply to the Registrar to act as a supervisor if they provide a training agreement that demonstrates a commitment to providing a learning of ethical and competent practices.

Section.Text: An applicant to be a supervisor under subsection 16(1) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide a training agreement that demonstrates a commitment to the learning of ethical and competent practices;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not be the subject of a matter before the Investigations Committee or Discipline Committee; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not have a suspended licence.

Section.Text: The Registrar must authorize an applicant to be a supervisor who meets the requirements under subsection 16(2) or section 17 to act as a supervisor.
The Registrar may revoke a supervisor’s authority to act as a supervisor if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the supervisor is the subject of a matter before the Investigations Committee or Discipline Committee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: their licence is suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they are no longer a licensee; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: they do not comply with the terms of the training agreement.

Section.Text: The Registrar must publish a policy on the College’s website with respect to the qualifying examinations, which includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dates of the examinations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registration process;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicable fees, as set out in items 2 to 4 of the schedule;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the process for administering the examinations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method of communication of the results of the examinations; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the opportunity to request a re-correction of the examination.

Section.Text: A class 3 licensee must write either the qualifying examination for patent agents or the qualifying examination for trademark agents, as applicable, at the first sitting of the examination that follows the completion of their training period.

The Registrar may appoint an advisory group made up of class 1 patent agent licensees, class 1 trademark agent licensees and representatives of the Patent Office and the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks to assist the Registrar in preparing, administering and marking the qualifying examinations.
An applicant for a class 1 patent agent licence or class 1 trademark agent licence must provide an application to the Registrar that provides proof of the applicant’s Canadian residency and must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: obtain a passing mark on the applicable qualifying examinations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: complete the applicable agent training course;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: comply with the terms of the training agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: remain of good character and provide, in support, letters of reference from the applicant’s supervisor and others with whom they worked, as a class 3 licensee or any other evidence that demonstrates that the applicant complied with the terms of the training agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: remain fit to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: affirm a declaration on registration, declaring that the licensee will practise with integrity, uphold the independence of the patent and trademark professions and comply with the Code of Professional Conduct; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: pay to the College the fee set out in item 5 of the schedule.

Section.Text: If the Registrar issues a class 1 licence, the Registrar must set the effective date of the licence.
A class 1 licensee may apply to the Registrar to change the class of their licence to a class 2 licence if they meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they provide their current and, if known, future contact information;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they provide their professional employment history;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they provide confirmation in writing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that all client matters have been completed or that arrangements have been made to the satisfaction of their clients to have their files returned to them or transferred to another class 1 licensee,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that any matters in progress at the Patent Office or the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks have been assigned to another class 1 licensee and the appropriate office has been advised in writing of the successor licensee,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: of the location of the files from the licensee’s practice; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: they pay to the College the fee set out in item 6 of the schedule.

Section.Text: If an applicant for a change of class of licence meets the requirements of section 25, the Registrar must change the licence to a class 2 licence and set the effective date for the change.
A class 2 licensee is subject to the following restrictions as of the effective date of the change of licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a class 2 patent agent licence, the licensee is not entitled to represent persons in the presentation and prosecution of applications for the registration of patents or in other business before the Patent Office; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a class 2 trademark agent licence, the licensee is not entitled to represent persons in the presentation and prosecution of applications for the registration of trademarks or in other business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks.

Subsection.Text: A class 2 licensee may apply to the Registrar to be reinstated as a class 1 licensee if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meet the applicable requirements under paragraphs 23(d) to (f);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pay to the College the fee set out in item 7 of the schedule; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: demonstrate that they will, as of the effective date of the class 1 licence, be insured against professional liability, as required under subsection 34(1) of the Act, or that they will be exempt from that requirement.

Subsection.Text: Upon receipt of an application, the Registrar may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: require the applicant to provide additional information that is useful for the consideration of the request; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: require the applicant to demonstrate that they have complied with any continuing professional development requirements.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate the applicant as a class 1 licensee if they meet the requirements or if the Registrar determines it is in the public interest, reinstate the licensee with restrictions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: refuse to reinstate the applicant’s licence if they do not satisfy the requirements or it is in the public interest to do so.

Section.MarginalNote: Deemed to be under supervision — patent agent

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 11(b), for a period of one year from the coming into force of these By-laws, a class 3 patent agent licensee is deemed to be supervised by a class 1 patent agent licensee if they are being supervised by an individual who is responsible for a legal clinic associated with a Canadian faculty of law.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Deemed to be under supervision — trademark agent
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 14(b), for a period of one year from the coming into force of these By-laws, a class 3 trademark agent licensee is deemed to be supervised by a class 1 trademark agent licensee if they are being supervised by an individual who is responsible for a legal clinic associated with a Canadian faculty of law.

Section.Text: These By-laws come into force on the day on which paragraph 76(1)(c) of the College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents Act, section 247 of chapter 27 of the Statutes of Canada, 2018, comes into force, but if they are registered after that day, they come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Footnote.Text: [Note: By-laws in force June 28, 2021, see SI/2021-30.]

row.entry: Application for initial registration as a Class 1 licensee
Application to change from Class 1 to Class 2
Application to change from Class 2 to Class 1
